abstract: Hershey is stepping up efforts to prepare a bid for Cadbury and plans to make a decision after Kraft Foods’ final offer for the U.K. chocolate maker, according to people with knowledge of the matter.
snippet: Hershey is stepping up efforts to prepare a bid for Cadbury and plans to make a decision after Kraft Foods’ final offer for the U.K. chocolate maker, according to people with knowledge of the matter.
lead_paragraph: Hershey is stepping up efforts to prepare a bid for Cadbury and plans to make a decision after Kraft Foods‘ final offer for the British chocolate maker, people with knowledge of the matter told Bloomberg News.

headline.main: Hershey Said to Speed Up Cadbury Efforts

abstract: JPMorgan Chase kicked off the latest, and highly anticipated round of bank earnings on Friday by reporting a $3.3 billion profit for the fourth quarter of 2009.
snippet: JPMorgan Chase kicked off the latest, and highly anticipated round of bank earnings on Friday by reporting a $3.3 billion profit for the fourth quarter of 2009.
lead_paragraph: Update | 8:02 a.m. JPMorgan Chase kicked off what is expected to be a robust — and controversial — reporting season for the nation’s banks Friday with news that its profit and pay for 2009 soared, The New York Times’s Eric Dash reports.

headline.main: JPMorgan Profit Rises Again, but Clouds Linger

abstract: The banking giant also earmarked $26.9 billion for its workers, much of which will now be paid out as bonuses.
snippet: The banking giant also earmarked $26.9 billion for its workers, much of which will now be paid out as bonuses.
lead_paragraph: JPMorgan Chase kicked off what is expected to be a robust  and controversial  reporting season for the nation’s banks on Friday with news that its profit and pay for 2009 soared.

headline.print_headline: Profit in 2009 Is $11.7 Billion For JPMorgan

abstract: Traders seemed to gloss over the headline numbers for JPMorgan and focused in on consumer credit and worries about credit card delinquencies.
snippet: Traders seemed to gloss over the headline numbers for JPMorgan and focused in on consumer credit and worries about credit card delinquencies.
lead_paragraph: Stock prices fell sharply on Friday, the worst day of trading this year, as worries over the strength of the American consumer eclipsed a round of mostly positive earnings reports.

headline.main: Dow Plunges 100 Points on JPMorgan’s News
headline.print_headline: Dow Plunges 100 Points On JPMorgan’s News

abstract: Jamie Dimon, JPMorgan Chase’s chief executive, believes it isn’t fair that the big banks would be the only ones forced to pick up the TARP tab under the proposed bank tax.
snippet: Jamie Dimon, JPMorgan Chase’s chief executive, believes it isn’t fair that the big banks would be the only ones forced to pick up the TARP tab under the proposed bank tax.
lead_paragraph: Jamie Dimon, JPMorgan Chase’s chief executive, says he believes it isn’t fair that the big banks will be the only ones forced to pick up the TARP tab under the proposed bank tax, suggesting that other companies that benefited from the government assistance program should pay up as well.

headline.main: Dimon’s Complaint: Bank Tax Isn’t Spread Fairly
